comment_5: Carey obviously depicts having a "vision of love." She is grateful to God (not a lover, as some may assume) for guiding her in life. Carey describes how she had to work to get where she is now, but with the help of the vision that she received from God. It is an autobiographical piece, penned by Carey herself, that includes the personal struggles she had endured through time as she worked to fulfill her dream/"vision."

comment_11:
This is a gospel song. "You", the one she prays to, is God, of course.

At first it's insinuated that she asked God to give her a husband who would give her everything she needed. But God gave her a vision of love.

And even though she sings that her prayers were answered, she still keeps on saying that the vision of love was _all_ that God gave her.

So did she or didn't get the loving husband from God?

The final verse gives the answer: "I had a vision of love and it was all that _you_ (God) turned out to be"!

The vision of love was God Himself! This is deeply a gospel song about God being in the first place in every woman's life.
